verses.roman:
bāhire vāmatā-krodha, bhitare sukha mane
'kuṭṭamita'-nāma ei bhāva-vibhūṣaṇe

synonyms: bāhire—externally; vāmatā—opposition; krodha—anger; bhitare—within; sukha—happiness; mane—in the mind; kuṭṭamita—kuṭṭamita; nāma—named; ei—this; bhāva-vibhūṣaṇe—ornament of an ecstatic attitude.
translation: "This ecstatic dress of Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī's is called kuṭṭamita. When it is manifest, She externally tries to avoid Kṛṣṇa, and She apparently becomes angry, although She is very happy within.
